column2: RI DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Rhode Island
column6: RI

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Get enough sleep.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 2. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column6: number of cars in front of you.
column8: number of cars behind you.

column2: 3. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 4. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: maintain
column6: double
column8: reduce

column2: 5. You are approaching an intersection with a traffic signal indicating a steady yellow light. If you have not already entered the intersection, you should:
column4: speed up to cross the intersection before the light turns red.
column6: slow down and proceed with caution through the intersection.
column8: stop before entering the intersection if it is safe to do so.

column2: 6. Drivers should use high beam headlights when:
column4: when they come within 50 feet of an oncoming vehicle.
column6: following another vehicle.
column8: there are no oncoming vehicles approaching.

column2: 7. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 8. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column6: the speed limit on that route.
column8: the type of route you are on.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 9. Only _____ can reduce the alcohol level in the blood.
column4: taking a cold shower
column6: time
column8: eating

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: One-way street ahead
column6: Turn left or go through
column8: Two way right turn

column2: 11. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: slow down and pass the bus with caution.
column6: stop if you are driving in the same direction.
column8: stop regardless of your direction of travel.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Stop Sign Ahead
column6: Warning, slippery when wet
column8: Railroad Warning

column2: 13. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.
column6: yield the right-of way to all vehicles that arrive after you.
column8: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column10: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.

column2: 14. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: stop until the person is well away from the roadway or path of travel.
column6: carefully drive around them.
column8: honk their horn as they proceed past them.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: Keep left
column8: Divided highway ahead

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column6: a narrow road ahead.
column8: a reduction of lanes.
column10: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Narrow Bridge
column6: No right turn
column8: No left turn

column2: 18. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: means that you need to stop.
column8: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 19. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Maintain the correct speed.
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: Keep your vehicle in good condition.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at next intersection
column6: No right turn
column8: No U-turns
column10: Right turn on red light permitted

column2: 21. Motorcycles:
column4: are easier to see than cars.
column6: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column8: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.

column2: 22. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.
column6: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column10: you have cleared the front bumper of the passed vehicle.

column2: 23. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column4: on the front.
column6: on the right.
column8: directly behind them.

column2: 24. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: pull the steering wheel back.
column6: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycle parking ahead
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Yield right-of-way to bicycles
column10: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
